channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi Announces Retirement From Congress in 2027
item.description: Representative Nancy Pelosi, the only female House speaker, said she will not run for re-election. She wielded immense power and became a Democratic i...

item.title: Anxious generation author warns Gen z’s brains are ‘growing around their phones’ the way a tree warps around a tombstone
item.description: Speaking at a Dartmouth symposium on mental health, NYU professor Jonathan Haidt discussed his research on “the Great Rewiring.”

item.title: Canada Is About to Lose Its Status as Having Eliminated Measles
item.description: One province with an outsize number of cases has seen a collision of politics and public health policy.

item.title: The ‘bike bus’ movement has taken over one New Jersey town, with hundreds biking to school each day: ‘People naturally gravitate to something that’s super joyful’
item.description: What began as a handful of parents hoping to encourage their kids to bike to school has grown into a weekly ritual for the township.

item.title: The ‘Worst Test in Medicine’ is Driving America’s High C-Section Rate
item.description: Round-the-clock fetal monitoring leads to unnecessary C-sections. But it’s used in nearly every birth because of business and legal concerns, The Time...

item.title: Trump admits the GOP was blindsided by economy fears as Democrats sweep key races: ‘Republicans don’t talk about the word affordability’
item.description: "We have the greatest economy right now. A lot of people don’t see that," Trump said.

item.title: How China’s Rare Earth Chokehold Could Strangle Europe’s Military Buildup
item.description: Drones, missiles and other crucial components of Europe’s rush to rearm itself rely on an increasingly unsteady supply of minerals from China.

item.title: For Gen Z, it’s ‘not enough to work hard’ if you want to succeed, says Jamie Dimon—specific skills are the way to get ahead
item.description: "In the old days, you could be in 10th grade, go get a factory in Detroit, and eventually you could afford a family, a home, a car, and that may not b...

item.title: The pope hates it. Norway hates it. Elon Musk calls them ‘corporate terrorists.’ Welcome to Tesla’s trillion-dollar showdown
item.description: “He frequently teeters on the edge of disaster," said Tesla owner and money manager Nancy Tengler, "and then pulls back just in the nick of time.”

item.title: As Mamdani Surges Ahead, Schumer Risks Finding Himself Left Behind
item.description: The rise of New York City’s mayor-elect comes at a complicated moment in the career of Senator Chuck Schumer, who is in danger of looking out of touch...

item.title: Mexico’s President Presses Charges After Being Groped on the Street
item.description: President Claudia Sheinbaum of Mexico said she filed a complaint against a man who groped and tried to kiss her in a public episode captured on video.

item.title: Scores of Palestinian Militants Still in Israeli-Controlled Parts of Gaza, Officials Say
item.description: At least some of the fighters are believed to be in the enclave’s vast tunnel network, marooned behind the “yellow line” that Israeli forces withdrew ...

item.title: Russia Close to Its Biggest Capture of a Ukrainian City Since 2023
item.description: The Kremlin is focusing its fire on Pokrovsk, a gateway to the Donetsk region, which Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin, has long coveted.

item.title: On Prince Andrews Road, a Frustrating Effort to Get a New Address
item.description: Villagers in Hellesdon, England, are pushing to change the name, but local bureaucracy makes it difficult.

item.title: Her Research Could Improve Training For Service Dogs
item.description: “This is a type of science that has an impact that most people could see in their homes,” said Erin Hecht, a canine researcher at Harvard. “Now there’...
